intro: Hyoseris rhagadioloides, commonly known as the desert sunflower, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy yellow blooms. The plant has a low, sprawling growth habit, with hairy stems and narrow, grass-like leaves adapted to reduce water loss. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Hyoseris rhagadioloides is well-suited to harsh environments, thriving in sandy or rocky soils with minimal water availability.
